intro: Tordylium carmeli, commonly known as the Carmel tordylium, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Tordylium carmeli is often grown as an ornamental plant for its attractive foliage and fragrant blooms.
